intro: Fuertesiella, commonly known as the "Mexican evergreen," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plants typically grow as shrubs or small trees, with smooth, glossy bark and lance-shaped leaves. Fuertesiella species are often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to their ornamental value, they are occasionally cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
